dialogues.text: I wasn't pausing to see if you did. [Beat] But, incidentally, you should, because you're birds of a feather. STARKS squints as he searches out Becker's face.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Ted raped and sodomized a seven-year old girl. [Beat] His lawyers asked me to have a look at him because, after his deeds were done... he climbed into the trees of the forest where he killed her and woofed like a dog. He couldn't even remember his name when I spoke to him, but, curiously enough, he could speak back. [Beat] Ted never went to prison because everyone -- including me -- was convinced he was sick. So he came here. BECKER leans into Starks' view to make sure he's listenin STARKS is.  54.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Then one day a little girl came with her mother to visit a relative and I caught Ted stealing looks at her -- the kind you really have to steal if you know what I mean. [Beat] I asked Ted then if he could remember what the little girl who he had... slain ...was wearing. [Beat] He gave me a look I'll never forget, and, when he answered, it wasn't with a color or any sort of physical description I'd expect. "Oh yes," he said. "I remember it. I remember it well." [Beat] Those were actually his last words I think. BECKER's expression bears a hunting mixture of anger and remorse as he recounts Ted's tale.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: We are not birds of a feather.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Maybe not. [Beat] But I do think you're in a tree... woofing like a dog. And I'm just trying to help you the only way I can think of. BECKER gets up and, as he moves out of the light, STARKS his BANDAGED CHEEK, reinforcing his memory of what happened... STARKS [Provokingly] What happened to your cheek, Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I was careless. Happens sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks out on the SNOW-COVERED GROUNDS from his roo the third floor. He seems pacified for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY, RECOVERY WARD, ALPINE GROVE, DAY
dialogues.text: Everything about the dingy hospital punctuates the sad mechanics of managing madness. CATATONIC PATIENTS and dat equipment litter the hall and, as we follow a NURSE who w among them, we spot STARKS -- ARMS suspended in air and G EYES fixed on the ceiling -- pretending to be one of them  55. His ARMS fall and he wipes his dried MOUTH as soon as she passes. STARKS has successfully made it out of his room. turns one corner as STARKS hustles to turn another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is almost there. As RANDOM ORDERLIES pass him, STA lets his posture collapse as he despondently hangs his he down so low they can't see his face. They pass, and STARK starts scuttling towards the door to the outside. As soon as he reaches it and is outside in the cold -- wi only his BLUE PATIENT UNIFORM -- Starks walks normally, l he no longer remembers the risks. Instead he remembers wh Jackie told him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: They found William Starks' body dead in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How'd he die?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. But he did die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS leans down -- seemingly oblivious to the cold -- a lifts some snow to his mouth, TASTING it like a man who n to affirm he is still alive. He's so rapt that LORENSON's VOICE takes him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Hey. You're not supposed to be out here. STARKS stiffens as he realizes he could be in the place w his body was found. The terrible question asks itself on face: Is this when Starks is killed? STARKS [Turning around sharply] What are you going to do to me?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Well... As LORENSON reaches into his POCKET for something, STARKS anxiously holds his breath. It's BLACK when it comes out a SKI HAT when it opens up. STARKS lets out his breath, relieved.  56. LORENSON [Nonchalantly] I thought I'd just ask you to come back inside with me.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: And if I didn't want to come?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I guess I'd ask you why.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Because I don't think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You're not crazy. STARKS is surprised by Lorenson's agreement.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You suffer from delusional disorder. That doesn't mean you're... crazy. It just means you're confused. And you're here, instead of in jail, because that was determined to have played a role in your killing of a police officer. STARKS [Correcting him] Alleged killing of a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You were convicted of the crime.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: That conviction doesn't convince me of anything. Until I know that I did it, I'm not going to accept that I did.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You may never remember at all. [Beat] Your mind's grasp of reality and the real events that have happened to you has been damaged.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. The real events that have happened to me have been fucked up. Not my mind. LORENSON seems to realize -- at least for an instant -- t is looking at a desperate man who is persuasively, and cogently, staring back at him.  57.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: [Beat] William, I'd like to ask you something if I can.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Since when do people around here have to ask permission to do anything? LORENSON [Suspiciously] How's your treatment progressing with Dr. Becker? STARKS still doesn't know how much Lorenson knows, and if should trust him.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Fine. [Beat] Why made you ask? LORENSON answers first with his eyes looking over Starks' body. STARKS merely stares back tersely. LORENSON [Carefully] I just hope you'd let me know if that wasn't the case.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I could try to...make it stop.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. I don't want it to.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: So it's helping? STARKS [Choosing his words carefully] [Beat] It's making me feel like a different person. LORENSON -- sensing she's not going to get any more from Starks -- turns around to go back inside. It's only as sh turns her face away from STARKS that we see how nervous s is. But you'd never guess it from her tone... LORENSON [Casually] You comin'? STARKS looks towards the FENCES locking him in from every direction. LORENSON waits until she hears STARKS' FOOTSTE following her. She waits until STARKS has reached her.  58.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You should be careful. You could be killed if they found you out here.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Believe me, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and MACKENZIE are eating opposite each other.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What were you talking about the other day?

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking about anything.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yeah, you were. What you said about them taking me out to the woods... MACKENZIE clams up slightly at the mention of it...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What do you know about the Jacket? MACKENZIE's eyes start to twitch nervously.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: I know you need one when it's really cold.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Cutting in] MacKenzie, listen to me. Listen. I'm going to die.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: Mortality's actually a great thing to be familiar with. It means you're sane on some level.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Gravely] No, I mean in four days, I'm supposed to die.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: [Beat] How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: The Jacket.  59. MACKENZIE grows visibly more nervous at this second menti of it.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: Oh no, you're pretty young. Your body'1ll be able to handle a lot more of it than you think...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. [Beat] I mean I found out while I was in it that my body's gonna be found in four days. Just then, NURSE HARDING is upon them. She carries a ROD her hand which she TAPS menacingly on the floor as she wa towards them.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: What are you two yappin' about? STARKS tenses up as he sees only the ROD, which could inf a GASH if hit across a man's head the right way. Nearly e object could be a threat to his life as this point. MACKENZIE [Spoken like a nut] [Beat] We're talking about our ability to go forward in time, to go into the future. [To Starks] That is what we're talking about here, right? STARKS is startled MacKenzie gets it.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: You know something? You're two fucking freaks is what you are. STARKS [Smiling] Well, no shit, Einstein. What do you think we're doing in this place? MACKENZIE tries not to laugh but a CHUCKLE slips out.

dialogues.speaker: HARDING
dialogues.text: I want the two of you to shut the fuck up and eat your food. HARDING walks away with a final stare that Starks returns STARKS [Under his breath] I gotta get back in it, MacKenzie.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: It's gonna be sticky.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why? MACKENZIE's body betrays his discomfort talking about it its sudden jerks accompanying every word.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause Lorenson's got her claws in it now. When she started getting suspicious about me was when they stopped using it on me. Women!

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: So what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: You could still always give Becker an itch. 'Course you might get killed when he goes to scratch it, but seems to me you're saying that's about to happen anyway. [Beat] Just be careful not to walk yourself right into something.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY, ALPINE GROVE, 1992, DAY
dialogues.text: Dr. LORENSON and DR. GRIES are walking briskly to a meeti

dialogues.speaker: DR. GRIES
dialogues.text: We're late.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I wish they'd skip the formality of this annual review and just cut our budget. Our silence on the matter should be enough to appease the civic conscience without wasting an hour we don't have.

dialogues.speaker: DR. GRIES
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not such a waste. LORENSON looks at GRIES askance before she sets the recor straight.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: It's the ticking of a box on a sheet of paper no one cares about.  61.

dialogues.speaker: DR. GRIES
dialogues.text: They don't care about all the things we do right. [Beat] But they might ...they might care about what we're doing wrong. [Beat] That's what they should come here to look for. LORENSON can see GRIES is trying to tell her something.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: What should they be looking for?

dialogues.speaker: DR. GRIES
dialogues.text: They should just be looking harder. LORENSON grabs GRIES' arm, sensing the import of her word

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Where? [Beat] It's Becker isn't it? He's doing stuff, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: DR. GRIES
dialogues.text: Later. I'll tell you about it later. We got a session to catch now.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WARD 3, ALPINE GROVE, 1992, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS is in a different ward with PATIENTS who appear mo threatening and disturbed. As he is anxiously looking aro presumably for a way out -- Starks hears one of the PATIE humming an eerily DISCORDANT MELODY. Looking to see who i comes from, STARKS happens to spot ONE PATIENT -- a young fierce-looking guy -- eyeing a YOUNG NURSE, SALLY, administering medication from a dated CART. STARKS looks around the room and notes there are NO DOCTO or ORDERLIES around. The YOUNG NURSE, meanwhile, is focus on the medicine -- oblivious to the BRUTE eyeing her. The BRUTE's not that far away when he starts walking towa the YOUNG NURSE. STARKS starts in their direction, pickin speed -- maneuvering through VARIOUS INCOHERENT PATIENTS the BRUTE reaches the NURSE. He throws her TRAY down and pushes her against the WALL. starts screaming as he pushes up against her. STARKS pick the TRAY and strikes the BRUTE across the head with it. The BRUTE holds his head in pain as he tries to regain hi balance. It's clear he's impaired. But it's also clear he understands pain.  62. STARKS [To Sally] You ok? As she NODS, her EYES dart above to the HAND about to str him. Off her look, he ducks and turns around, punching th BRUTE in the stomach -- HARD -- but not before the piece he held from one of the broken MEDICINE BOTTLES comes perilously close to STARKS' head. The BRUTE bowls over and STARKS looks at the GLASS terrif Is this when he dies? The BRUTE -- incensed more than ever -- lunges at him a f STARKS gets him by the NECK, expertly applying PRESSURE POINTS and, after only a few seconds, subdues him. STARKS himself seems surprised that he knew how to use them. He out a suspended BREATH, instinctively touching his FOREHE to make sure he's not cut. He looks back at SALLY.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yeah, Why are you in this ward alone? Where is everyone? SALLY [Defensively] There's a state rep visiting so they've moved everyone around. But I've been alone before...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Where are the other orderlies?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: In the therapy session downstairs. That's what the rep's sitting in on...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Ok, listen. I want you to get out of here and lock the door behind you. I'll go get some doctors. SALLY looks at STARKS, wondering whether she can trust hi Her eyes shift to the BRUTE on the floor and she remember that she can.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STATE REP -- 40s, disgruntled, even drowsy -- is recognizable among a group that includes the CHIEF OF STA (Dr. Williams), BECKER, LORENSON and GRIES. They are presiding over a GROUP THERAPY SESSION when STARKS enters STARKS [Calling out] Sorry I'm late, Dr. Becker. BECKER is noticeably taken aback but tempers his response

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Mr. Starks, this session is for our civil patients. Damon, please take Mr. Starks back to his ward. STARKS cuts him off and threatens with his gaze. STARKS [Derisively] No. Please, Dr. Becker. You can strap me in a Jacket or even gag me, but please don't leave me out of therapy. This is where I feel like I make the most progress. BECKER relents, seeing STARKS has the upper hand -- an AUDIENCE, deranged but eager no less.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Fine, Mr. Starks. You can pull up a chair for yourself. As STARKS walks across the room, it's obvious to everyone they turn their heads to watch him -- that he is a physic ailing man. Using all his strength, he walks up slowly to group, dragging a CHAIR behind him because he doesn't hav the strength to lift it. STARKS sits down.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Mr. Jensen, please continue. JENSEN -- a twitchy schizophrenic -- surveys the group seriously, determining whether it's safe to say what he's about to...

dialogues.speaker: JENSEN
dialogues.text: Well, [beat] I've been approached by the Federal Trade Organization. BECKER's not listening to a word JENSEN says. But STARKS  64. BECKER [Calm as ever] And what have they approached you about, Mr. Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: JENSEN
dialogues.text: They want me to head the Organization for the Organized. The other PATIENTS look at him in wonder as the STATE REP listens limply.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: The Organization...for the Organized?

dialogues.speaker: JENSEN
dialogues.text: That's right. Have you heard of them?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Jensen. I have not.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP PATIENT 2
dialogues.text: That's because there is no such Organization, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: JENSEN
dialogues.text: That is categorically not true. Bl-bl- blatantly and manifestly NOT TRUE. I've been asked to lead them. But, if you'd heard of them, then they wouldn't be hush-hush, would they? BECKER [Wearily] What do the rest of you think? The GROUP stares at one another silently. STARKS [Loud and emphatic] Well, [beat] I know they exist.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: And how is that? STARKS looks at JENSEN, who looks back avidly. MACKENZIE Starks nervously, like he senses what he is about to do.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: When I was in the Gulf, the Organization was recruiting the Organized.  65. BECKER [Incensed] Is that a fact, Mr. Starks? Because if it's not, it doesn't help Mr. Jensen. STARKS [Looking right at Jensen] It is a fact. Bona fide, and classified. LORENSON and MACKENZIE watch STARKS curiously.

dialogues.speaker: JENSEN
dialogues.text: I knew it! I knew it! Those little fuckers are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: They recruit only the best, Mr. Jensen. [Beat] I didn't want to have to say this... Not even the DOCTORS dare disrupt the silence...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: But these people [pointing to the Doctors] know about it. In fact, when Presidents of this country and heads of state leave office, they come here, to Alpine Grove. They're among us right now! [Looking right at Becker] Isn't that right, Dr. Thatcher? And Jensen, I'm proud they picked you. JENSEN looks on nobly.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: They're always ordering us to stay calm, but how can we be calm? STARKS suddenly turns right at Becker, wrapping his messa to him in the seemingly crazed theatrics of a nut.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Looking suddenly directly at Becker] All they do is give orders. That's all they have to do. And no one will ever know. All it comes down to is an order. [Beat] They've got hands everywhere. STARKS stands up, ready to SALUTE Mr. Jensen. The OBSERVE look to BECKER for order.  66.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Long live the Organization for the Organized!

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Starks! Sit down, Mr. Starks! But, at that, Jensen's completely lost it. His excitement erupts in the form of him JUMPING out of his chair and eagerly and elatedly HITTING HIMSELF in the head.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Jensen! Too late. OTHER PATIENTS are on their feet, HANDS jubilan up in the air. And, in the midst of the havoc, the speech order is soundly delivered in Becker's NOD to Damon.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM PATIENTS
dialogues.text: Dr. Thatcher! Dr. Becker! DAMON and HARDING grab STARKS while the other members of STAFF slowly calm the other patients. LORENSON is too bus notice them taking Starks out. STARKS winks at MACKENZIE, smiles somewhat sadly back. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING and DAMON stand above Starks, who lies on the bru slab, already hemmed in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Starks, you're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick. DAMON slams him in the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' eyes dart about him; it sounds like something is there with him. The sound stops momentarily and, then, ou nowhere, a DROP falls on his eye. PING! STARKS winces. He clenches his face, not knowing when the next drop will fa His heart starts to beat more and more madly, punctuated the DRIPS -- making a score fit only for hell. He closes eyes and begins to die...  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and TENNY -- 30s, shifty, a total stranger -- sit silence in TENNY'S CAR. (We recognize the murder scene.) POLICE LIGHTS FLASH in the rearview mirror though STARKS doesn't see them yet. STARKS and TENNY are talking to one another. TENNY's voic takes a dangerous tone.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: You ever been to jail?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. TENNY nods, distracting STARKS long enough to slip a hand down his leg to the GUN he's hidden there.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: It's worse than war. It's worse than anywhere you've ever been.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I doubt it. [Beat] I don't think prison's so bad you don't want to remember it... TENNY carefully pulls over to the side of the road, assur and cautious with each word, each move.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: Well, I've never been to war, but I'm sure as hell not going back to prison. STARKS [Finally spotting Harrison] What's he pulling us over for? TENNY [Still preparing himself] Recreation. OFFICER HARRISON walks up to their car.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER HARRISON
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I'm gonna need you to step out of the car, with your hands at your side please.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why?  68. OFFICER HARRISON [Sternly] Step out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Ok, sir. I was just asking what for.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER HARRISON
dialogues.text: This is a stolen vehicle you're driving. Now put your hands in the air, out where I can see ‘em. That's the second when OFFICER HARRISON sees where TENNY' HAND is. As he reaches for his own GUN, the situation explodes as TWO FLASHES eclipse all else. OFFICER HARRISO goes down, still holding his own GUN and STARKS jumps out the car to check on him.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what'd you do that for? TENNY looks around, still holding the GUN. Starks swallow assessing whether to back away or not. TENNY waves his gu he half points it in Harrison's direction. Then, GUN stil hand, he smirks nervously and looks at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: Man, if you're so deaf and dumb, you ain't even worth a fucking bullet. TENNY raises the gun, then aims it away from STARKS and shoots OFFICER HARRISON once more. From the ground, OFFIC HARRISON fires back and STARKS, now lunging at Tenny, TAK THE HIT. STARKS falls, clearly unable to get up, let alone pursue anyone. TENNY smiles sardonically and slowly puts the GUN his back pocket as he turns to leave. This SMILE was one the eerie FLASHES that haunted Starks in the JACKET... STARKS struggles but can't move. That's when he passes ou looking at OFFICER HARRISON from the ground, as he did in scene before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stands in the lighted tunnel, which only gets brig as his heart races with fear in the first seconds that he back in there. Then he sees an IMAGE of a WOMAN'S FOREHEA that lulls him to a calm until his heart slows and the LI gradually dims... FADE TO BLACK.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS enters the diner, calming down even more as he spo JACKIE. She looks up, holding PLATES in her hand. She's understandably surprised and unexpectedly pleased when sh sees him. She greets him with a small smile. She drops off her orders and then walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I'll be off in 15 minutes. Can you wait till then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE smoke in the cold, standing next to the hood of her car.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: The Jacket. That's what they call it, right?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It was banned, you know... and it led to an investigation of Dr. Becker's mistreatment of some of his patients. That's when they found out how badly he was drugging his patients...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Starting to make sense] So he was giving me all kinds of drugs... JACKIE [Nodding] Apparently. He was taking a lot of them, too. It said he was trying out behavior modification treatments that were banned back in the 70s -- "womb treatment" is the name he gave to what he did to you... STARKS [Cutting in] Womb? A fuckin' womb? What kind of animal did he come out of?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: But no one knew until after...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: After I...  JACKIE nods. JACKIE nods. 70.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: [Beat] You bled to death.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don't know how you got the cut to your head, but you died bleeding from it. STARKS [Digesting] And you're sure my body was found on January lst?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Do you really believe me?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. [Beat] I thought I was crazy after you left that day. I died. I still think I could be crazy. But then I replayed that night in my head -- the parts of it I could remember -- and it was like...I don't care if I was, or am. I haven't felt that way in a room with someone my whole life. [Beat] And when you left, all I wanted was... JACKIE looks around her; coupled with the cold, her sobri is obvious. STARKS takes hold of her and holds her face close to his so that their foreheads touch.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: [Softly] I want to trust you. Should I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Then we need to figure out what happened to you. It's the only thing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I know.  71.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Alpine Grove still exists. I looked it up on the net. We should go there and see if there's still anyone around who might have known what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: If they don't take me out before then. [As an afterthought] What's the net? JACKIE looks at him and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: They are driving through VERMONT to ALPINE GROVE. STARKS looks out the window and watches her drive.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I didn't kill Officer Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How? Did they figure it out after I died?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: No. They never figured it out. I did. Most murderers don't stop to help a drunk woman and her little girl on the side of the road. Not without hurting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE sit opposite DR. MORGAN, the current yo face of the hospital. MORGAN has a boyish face and a matc gullibility.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I can't tell you more about your father's death, Mr. Starks. Our own medical examiners determined only that he died from a blunt trauma to the head but that was right around the time the Alpine Grove's staff changed and I'm afraid we didn't have the best record system before then.  STARKS doesn' 72.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: His body was found on January 1, 1993, but do you know if that was long after he had died?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: No, I don't. I'm sorry. I wish I knew more.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What about Dr. Thomas Becker or Dr. Loel Lorenson? There was also a Dr. Gries, I think.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Well, Dr. Lorenson is still here at the hospital. If she was here at the time your father was, then I'm sure she'd be of more help to you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What about Dr. Becker and Mr. Gries?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, I'm not familiar with Dr. Becker and Dr. Gries passed away three, four years ago.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Do you have any kind of forwarding address for Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Your father was here 12 years ago. I doubt the hospital would have that, if Dr. Becker is still even alive. [Beat, a little suspiciously] Is there a particular reason you need to know how your father died? t waver when he answers.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: He was the only family I remember. DR. MORGAN [Nodding] I'll see what I can find out about Dr. Becker. And maybe Dr. Lorenson will know something.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. MORGAN leads JACKIE and STARKS through a ward. STARKS looks around in disbelief; it's more like a hospital now it ever was in 1993.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they arrive outside Lorenson's office, MORGAN turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Let me just tell her we're here. DR. MORGAN goes inside and JACKIE takes STARKS' HAND as t wait. It's hardly more than a couple seconds when LORENSO appears in the doorway. She looks at STARKS curiously and two share a very lengthy, intense STARE. DR. LORENSON -- now in her 50s -- walks closer to Starks suspiciously. For his part, STARKS doesn't look as unfami with Lorenson as he should; this doesn't escape Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Hello. I'm Beth Lorenson. She puts out a hand that is trembling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: It's nice to meet you, Mr. Starks... STARKS hesitates before he takes Lorenson's hand. There i something very eerie about the exchange. STARKS quickly l go and LORENSON turns to JACKIE...

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: And you are...? JACKIE looks back uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I'm just William's friend. LORENSON looks over both of them acutely and then calmly turns to Dr. Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I think we'll be fine from here. Thanks, Stanley.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON leans against her desk while STARKS and JACKIE s in the chairs. As they talk, each seems cautious in his exchange -- not knowing what the other one does or doesn' know.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: My God you look exactly like him.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I never knew my father. Did you?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. [Beat] He was my most memorable patient.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why? LORENSON considers her answer.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: At the end, he made me change my mind about a lot of things.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You thought my father was crazy?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: No. I don't think he was crazy. He needed help...but he wasn't crazy. [Beat] Your father actually helped me with a case of mine. LORENSON waits to see if STARKS knows what she is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What case?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I was working with a boy named Eugene. STARKS shows no recognition but JACKIE does.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Who was Eugene? LORENSON [Peaked] He was a friend's son. [Beat] Are you familiar with the case?  75.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Just a little, when we were looking up information about William's father. How did he help?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: It's complicated, but [looking at Starks] in a way, your father let me know how I'd get through to him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: He just said...that I'd shock Eugene and then things would change for him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I still don't either, even after all these years.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Do you know how my father died? LORENSON [Unconvincingly] I don't know how much I remember but I seem to think it was from a... cut or blow of some sort or another.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How'd he get it?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: [Beat] I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: But Dr. Morgan said you were around when my father was...

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I was. But I saw a lot of cuts and a lot of blows. I'm sorry I don't know more about your father's. [Sincerely] I didn't know about everything that went on here. LORENSON says it like she's hiding something.  76.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Well, do you think Dr. Becker would have any idea?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: How do you know about Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: My dad wrote some things down before he died. LORENSON looks like she's suddenly remembering something.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: That's right. He did. STARKS looks at Lorenson curiously; he doesn't know what Lorenson is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: So maybe Dr. Becker would know. [Beat] But, as I'm sure you know, the statute of limitations has run out for charging the hospital with any liabilities.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why would we do that? STARKS just stares at LORENSON, not knowing if he died by this man's hands or not, not knowing who he can trust...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure. Like you said about back then, you might not know everything going on around here. DR. LORENSON looks right at STARKS.  77.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: It's important for you to know who your father was, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] Yeah, it is. LORENSON [Eerily] It's almost as if your life depended on it. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Well... [beat] let me know how your search turns out.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] We will.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY, ALPINE GROVE, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE walk briskly down it, away from Lorenso office.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't believe a thing she just said.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Me neither. Who was the boy she was talking about, Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You think Lorenson kills you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Maybe. I don't know. Seems more likely Becker does, but at the very least she knows how I died.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Let's see if they have an address for Becker. I also want to figure out more about the kid you helped her with.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Why?  78.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Because that's the part I believe is true. You probably did help her somehow with the boy and Eugene's name did come up over and over again on the abstracts I pulled. STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] There's one more thing I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, determined, now leads JACKIE. As they reach the e of the hall, we see DAMON -- now in his 50s -- look after curiously before he goes back to his work with a PATIENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE watches STARKS ignore the "Authorized Personnel On SIGN as he pushes the door open without so much as a paus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morgue looks exactly as before. STARKS is momentarily jarred in the room. He looks to the wall on which the JACKET hung and sees only the BARE HOOK that used to hold it up.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: This was the room. They used to hang the Jacket there. [Turning to Jackie] This is where it happened. This is the room I'm actually in right now. JACKIE isn't doubtful, but it's also hard to be convinced...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I can show you. It's probably in there. STARKS walks to the CADAVER DRAWERS and rests his hands o the one they put him in. Then, with great difficulty -- physical and emotional -- he opens it to see if there is anything left. He pulls it out, and there's nothing in there.  79.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe this wasn't such a good idea... STARKS leans closer, locating all the proof he needs: the stained metal -- still reddened and browned with DRIED BL and the part of the morgue slab he CLAWED his NAILS into he was in it. JACKIE looks at it in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yes, it was. [Softly] My fingers were the only things I could move. [Beat] Dead bodies don't bleed. And they certainly can't claw so hard they dent metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE are leaving the MORGUE, when STARKS spo DAMON, now hardly a hair of the bully he was before. DAMO stares at him curiously; STARKS glares back furiously.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You folks ain't supposed to be down here.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: We were just leaving. DAMON doesn't take his eyes off Starks.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You may have known my father, William Starks. DAMON smiles, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: That's right! Goddamn, you're the spitting image. I didn't know he had a son.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: He didn't either. DAMON [With a dirty laugh] I'll be damned. He musta been 12 when he had you. [Beat] You could be his ghost.  STARKS looms Damon's eyes

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Did you know my father?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, sure. He killed a cop, right? strangely over DAMON in this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You wouldn't happen to know how he died, would you? DAMON [Slightly apprehensive] No, I don't. I just remember them finding his body.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You don't know any more, Damon? DAMON [Shocked] How'd you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: My father used to talk about you.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, what'd he say? betray his unease.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: He said you were a sadistic fuck that belonged in jail. DAMON is shocked, and cowed. So much that he shakes as looks for his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Look here, I don't like you getting in my face and saying this bullshit to me...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I thought you said you never knew your father.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I didn't. [Beat] Did you have anything to do with his death? he 80.  81.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, man. I swear. This is some weird shit you're telling me... and I don't know how come you're doing it. STARKS starts to see a shaking man who stands confused an distraught before him.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: He died because he bled to death from a blow to his head. Someone had to have given him it.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I never touched your father! I swear! Damon's eyes are filled with dishonesty, tears and a crav FEAR. STARKS leans in closer to DAMON as he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You know something, Damon? You're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick. Live with it. STARKS looks like he could easily bash Damon's head again the wall, but instead he lets it go and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CEMETERY, ALPINE GROVE GROUNDS, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS is standing above his own headstone: WILLIAM STARK December 25, 1967 - January 1, 1993. Next to his grave is of RUDY MACKENZIE. STARKS looks down sadly at both. JACKI comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: How long do we have?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: They told me Becker's in Shelbourne now. I looked him up and he was listed. STARKS looks scared and lost -- like it's all catching up him. And like he might be being taken out of the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How far away is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE kisses his SCARS -- from the war and the Jacket -- STARKS lifts her higher so he can look at her as they mak love for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM, JACKIE'S APARTMENT, NIGHT
dialogues.text: JACKIE is lying in STARKS' arms, running her FINGERS over of the SCARS on his chest. STARKS strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What about Captain Medley? He never told them what happened to you over there. His testimony...that coward wanted them to think you were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I know. It was perfect. [Beat] Erase my sanity and you erase anything I'll ever say. JACKIE [Frustrated] Well, doesn't what he did to you make you mad?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Of course it makes me mad. It makes me more than mad. Just like remembering the face of the man who killed that officer and knowing nothing more about him. But what's it gonna do for me to find them now? I can't fix everything in three days.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You've got to get yourself out of that place. They're going to kill you if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I might not be able to.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It's not a prison, it's a hospital. There's got to be some way out of there and you've got to find it... She doesn't finish because it's too hard to. STARKS nods, wiping her tears and kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sore sound of the DRAWER being opened stirs Jackie -- awakening her as if she heard it in her sleep. She reache across the bed, but STARKS is no longer there. She runs h hands over the bed like he's alive in the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON is administering medicine to a patient in th ward, when she sees -- almost like a shadow -- a STRETCHE being wheeled down the hall. She finishes with the patien and runs to the end of the hall in search of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lies recovering under a small light above his hosp bed. His body bears marks of the brutalization. As we pul back, we see DR. LORENSON standing guard over him at the of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WARD, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: STARKS sits by a window -- I.V.'s in his arm -- smoking f still severely weak from the Jacket, while DR. LORENSON observes him for a bit from the hall before she goes insi

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You'll die if you keep smoking those in your condition.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'll die either way. LORENSON pulls up a chair and sits opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I can't try to help you unless you let me. [Beat] I know about the Jacket. STARKS waits to see what this means.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for what you were put through, and I'm sorry I couldn't stop it earlier. But I promise you that I will from now on... STARKS [Cutting him off] I don't want you to. LORENSON doesn't understand.  85.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You have no idea what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: No, I do. That's what I'm saying to you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Listen to me! You don't! The Jacket is my only chance in this place. LORENSON just thinks it's another delusion.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: How can you say that in your physical condition? Do you realize that it's because you were put in it that you're as...weak as you are now? Becker's a man who's not well himself. STARKS searches for words that won't sound as crazy as he knows he appears. They don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Then help me understand. You know, you're not alone. A lot of Gulf Vets have begun to experience curious symptoms. What you have might well be a syndrome and, if so, it's not one we know enough about to be treating it this vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with that. LORENSON [Exasperated] Then what? What? [Beat] I can't guess it. You have to help me. STARKS fixes his eyes on Lorenson. He has nothing to lose still he treads carefully. The words that follow come alm unwittingly.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: ..-What you do not know is the only thing you know. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (cont'd) [Beat] And what you own is what you do not own... And where you are is where you are not.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: [Beat] Where is that from? It's as though STARKS hears his words for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't know. [Frustrated] Remember?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Come on. Tell me what you do know.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] I've seen a time that's not this time. And I'm only able to see it when I'm in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Well, what time is it?
LORENSON nods, trying to mask his dismay but failing.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You don't believe me. LORENSON [Testing him] Well, what year do you think it is now? STARKS [Exasperated] I'm not delusional. I know it's 1992. Same as every sane person.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Ok fine. Tell me about it. Tell me about the future. 2004. What does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: It doesn't look all that different.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: The future doesn't look different?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. Not for people like me. [Beat] Not in the places I come from.  87.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: What about the world?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I didn't see that much of it -- same as now. I only saw it as part of my own life. LORENSON looks at STARKS, unintentionally patronizing.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Do you think you're traveling in time? Is that it? STARKS shakes his head and momentarily challenges Lorenso simply with his air of calm resolve.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Not everyone in here is crazy, Doc. LORENSON searches for another approach.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: [Beat] Like who? Like MacKenzie maybe?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Maybe. LORENSON [Matter-of-factly] Did he tell you he tried to kill his wife? STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: MacKenzie locked himself up in his house for two months and nearly starved himself to death before he was brought here. All because his wife left him for another man. STARKS moves to put his cigarette out and his I.V. almost falls out of his arm. LORENSON makes a move to adjust it STARKS flinches perceptibly, startling LORENSON. STARKS [Adjusting it himself] Maybe that just makes him weak, not crazy. Or maybe he is crazy. [Beat] Still doesn't make me think I am. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Adjusting it himself] And, judging by the fact that you just told me about another patient, it doesn't even make you think I am, so what don't you work on persuading yourself first.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Why don't you help me?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Because I don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'm about to die unless I do something to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: And how do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Because of the future. I know what's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: William, that is just another facet of my delusions. Then, STARKS remembers the only thing that might help him pauses, trying to recall as much of it as he can.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: And what about your work with Eugene -- the kid? Is that another facet of my delusions? LORENSON -- having prepared to continue -- is bowled over the mention of her patient. She loses all color and calm her features.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: How do you know about Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You told me about him. I saw you and I think you thought I knew something about him. So you told me. LORENSON doesn't know what to say. LORENSON [Somewhat angrily] How do you know about Eugene!?  89. STARKS [Shaking his head in disbelief] You told me. It's like two parts of you talking through me. Look, judging from your reaction, there's no other way I could know about him.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: There obviously is, so what don't you just tell me how you found out about him. STARKS looks at her convincingly.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Some part of you suspects -- even if you don't know for sure -- that what I'm saying is true.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I don't know how you know about Eugene, but these ideas are part of your delusions.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: NO! They're not my delusions! Look, just leave my business with Becker to me!

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: One thing's got nothing to do with the other.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: One's got everything to do with the other. So unless you want my blood on your hands...leave what's between me and Becker between me and Becker. LORENSON backs off, jarred by Starks' assertions and fear of his debilitating vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE sits idly on one of the hallway benches until t hallway is clear of the STAFF. Then he scuttles quickly - the time close to the wall -- to Starks' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE gets inside, ducks as a NURSE passes and then t lightly on the wall, announcing himself gladly.  90.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: Hey, I brought you some smokes. STARKS doesn't waste any time.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Lorenson said your wife left you for another man and that's when you lost it. MACKENZIE almost imperceptibly winces -- confirming the t for Starks -- before he has to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: Geez, how's that for a fucking "thank you"?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Is it true? MACKENZIE tosses him the CIGARETTES and lights himself on

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: She left me, I tried to kill her, I tried to kill myself. She was mean, I was weak, I was cruel so she left, I didn't plan it, didn't see it...FINE! MACKENZIE suddenly stops, distraught. When he resumes, it in an oddly more normal tone than he's ever used before. MACKENZIE [Softly] I didn't want to see it. I'm in here because they say I have a nervous condition. [Beat] Well, here's my question, who wouldn't be nervous if they really looked at their life? [Beat] Whose life is that good? STARKS doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: Not this luckless little mammal's. What difference is it to them? [Beat, slows down] You believe what you want to believe. One version is easier than another so you make it your own. As MacKenzie runs his hand over his forehead, he looks hu and sad, but strangely not a bit crazy.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: I'll tell you this though. However nuts I am, I wasn't nuts enough not to know how wrong it was to put a human being in something like that. MACKENZIE's twitching continues as he recollects it.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: [Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops more pills than all of Ward 3.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Becker does? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MACKENZIE
dialogues.text: I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this. STARKS nods and MacKenzie puts his head down, suddenly vulnerable and embarrassed. STARKS lights TWO CIGARETTES.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Thanks for the cigarettes. You still got a lot of problems, MacKenzie, but you're ok. MACKENZIE and STARKS smoke together quietly. INT. STARKS' ROOM, ALPINE GROVE, DECEMBER 29th, 1992 STARKS is trying to see if the windows open through the b covering them. It's especially hard with the I.V. still connected to one of his arms.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: At least it's some kind of bars we've got you behind. STARKS turns, startled.  92.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Hello, William. I understand you've been asking for me almost every hour. I would've been here sooner but you gave our little state visitor quite a bit to talk to me about.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: It is. But when it comes down to it, you just have to patient with them. They'd rather have their vacation, too, so they just push dealing with our "practices" off to the New Year.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: They make it hard for you to get away with your business, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Temporarily. STARKS lights a cigarette and, with that gesture, adopts unscrupulousness of a criminal so convincingly it bears little resemblance to his usual demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Makes it a little easier for me to get away with mine. BECKER looks at STARKS seriously.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: My business?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Getting away with things. Like whatever I may or may not have gotten away with Officer Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: You killed him? STARKS simply delivers one slow nod.  BECKER looks 93.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: And wound up in a better cage. [Beat] But I still want to make a deal. understandably disgusted and STARKS proceeds with the calculation of someone who is guilty.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: See, the deluxe lab animal treatment I've been receiving -- well, I don't think it's worked. I woke up today and realized... [eerily lowering his voice] ...I don't think I'm cured. So really, what was the point? Torture? I think that's still sort of illegal in some states -- though we'll have to check on Vermont. And, how's this for the cherry on top: it seems my physician is a pill-popping freak. [Beat] Last time I checked, that makes some pretty good copy for a lot of these news shows. [Humbly, deftly] "I don't remember everything they did to me. I just remember the worst parts." I think I should be sitting down when I say it, don't you think? It takes BECKER some seconds to swallow this. BECKER cocks

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I think...I have to think about it. his head to one side as he does. Then he slowly makes his way over to STARKS and leans in closer to him. STARKS instinctively raises his hand to his HEAD -- prepa to be defensive if he has to be. If this is the moment wh he's killed. But BECKER only YANKS the I.V. angrily out of Starks' arm tearing his skin with it. BECKER turns

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I think your story needs a little fleshing out before it's ready to go. to leave as STARKS bleeds onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I'll say a prayer for you in Church today, Starks. Maybe the Gods can pick up where the medicine left off.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You sure you know where to find one?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I've managed to every Sunday of my life. [Beat] Some of us are God- fearing men, Starks.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: And what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Means we believe in doing his work and fear what the world would be like if we didn't at least try to. STARKS smirks at the hypocrisy he sees.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Becker, how do you sleep at night?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: You in here. [Beat] Works like a drug. BECKER leaves without looking back and STARKS closes his eyes, breathing a sigh of relief that it's over.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NURSE STATION, ALPINE GROVE, 1992, EVENING
dialogues.text: LORENSON, dressed to leave, stops to talk to NINA, one of evening nurses.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Nina, William Starks is to stay in IcU all night. If anything is supposed to change, I want to be called about it.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Sure, Dr. Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON comes home to an unremarkable apartment to find thin, young mother, TALIA YAZDI, and her eleven year-old mute, and seemingly retarded son, EUGENE, waiting for her outside her door.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Hi. [Beat] Sorry I'm late.  95.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: It's ok. [To Eugene] Hi, Eugene. EUGENE returns her greeting with a blank stare.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LORENSON'S HOME, VERMONT, SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: LORENSON sets her things down on the kitchen table as TAL starts to tidy things around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Talia, I need to ask you something. TALIA looks at LORENSON.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Have you told anyone about my sessions with Eugene? TALIA [With an accent] Of course not. [Off Lorenson's still doubtful look] I swear I haven't. I wouldn't do that to Eugene, or you. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Has anyone been asking about him?

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: No. I would have told you. LORENSON nods. She believes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS spots DAMON standing cautiously in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see (but don't hear) HARDING speak to NINA as DAMON sl into STARKS' ROOM. NINA seems sufficiently distracted.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STARKS' ROOM, SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: DAMON flashes a KNIFE at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: No funny business or we can make this a lot fucking harder for you.  96. One look at the KNIFE and the SAME QUESTION burns once mo

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Weakly] No funny business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON hustles Starks down the hall as fast as they can be the NURSE or any other staff member spots them.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFFICE/LIBRARY, LORENSON'S HOME, NIGHT
dialogues.text: EUGENE sits opposite LORENSON, who quietly observes him, jotting some notes down on her pad. She is intermittently holding up PICTURES for Eugene, asking him to repeat thei names as if she were teaching him to read.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Eugene, this is a "TRAIN." EUGENE starts to pronounce the word when abruptly, and without any warning, he looks like he's unconscious, only with a blank stare. Lorenson quickly moves beside Eugene watches him from up close, apparently not altogether surprised at what's happening. EUGENE doesn't even blink. The only sounds we hear from h are a couple, barely audible guttural noises. LORENSON -- exhausted -- takes off her glasses wearily and gently addresses the boy.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Come on back down here. Wherever you are...try to come on back. You'll like it, I promise. Just then, TALIA walks in with TEA, JUICE and COOKIES for Eugene and Lorenson. She spots her son in his absent, sta state and forces her face into a small, sad smile to avoi tears as she sets the tray down and the cookies before th TALIA gently touches LORENSON'S hand. LORENSON looks at h warmly. TALIA knows how hard she's trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER soundlessly watches as HARDING and DAMON finish strapping Starks in the Jacket. DAMON slams the DRAWER shut, sending STARKS back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What STARKS lacks in strength, he counteracts with his OVERWHELMING WILL. The SCREEN TREMBLES with it. One TERRI WHITE LIGHT and we... cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, SHELBOURNE, VERMONT, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS sits by himself in Jackie's car, parked in a gas station. He looks around, trying to make sure it really i her car. He looks in the back and sees a pair of sneakers an empty BOTTLE of VODKA. He looks outside and sees a few people walking into the F MART of the gas station. He trembles with cold as he look down at his plaid shirt. Then, JACKIE unexpectedly appears outside the DRIVER'S WI opening the car door and nearly spilling her COFFEE when spots STARKS next to her. Seeing it's him though, she smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You just scared me, that's all. She leans over to him and gives him a kiss, handing him t coffee.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Here, drink this. I'll get the heat going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE speeds through the streets of Shelbourne, presumab on their way to Becker's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've slowed down a little.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: JACKIE reads from some directions on a PAPER as their CAR slows down on one particular street, towards one particul house.  98.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I think this is his house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at the house, bedecked with a lopsided SNOW on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I called the number yesterday to make sure. Thomas Becker, retired M.D. STARKS gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS knocks on the door. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: JACKIE tries to look through the windows to see if anyone there. No one is. It looks small and dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS knocks again, looking down anxiously at his feet. JACKIE walks up to him from around the side of the house. They don't have the time to wait.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: They're not here.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: They're not.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: [Beat, lost] No. JACKIE notices how COLD Starks looks.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe they're out. STARKS nods.  99.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS rubs his hands together as he looks out the window and sees NO CARS or PEOPLE on the street. JACKIE watches despairingly. JACKIE looks STARKS turns

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: How much time do we have? STARKS [Distracted] I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What? What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: There're no cars on this street. around; there really aren't.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. But wait, how can that be? to JACKIE, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe that's because this whole thing is a dream. How can you have a street with no cars on it?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. But this isn't a dream. I'm real, and so is where we are.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Then why isn't there anyone around?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: [Beat] I don't know. STARKS runs his hand over his head and closes his eyes in desperation.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? STARKS doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: William! William! STARKS opens his eyes. She sighs in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's gone somewhere. He'll have to come back. STARKS starts to shake his head in disbelief, when sudden he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Of course he will. [Beat] What day of the week is it?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It's Sunday. STARKS [Nodding] It's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: So? STARKS looks ecstatic with hope.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Look where these people live. A small, beautiful, removed place.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: They've got lives to be grateful for.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: William, you're not making sense.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] They're at Church. And I bet that's where Becker is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS head back to the only MAIN STREET in th town. As they approach the town church, they start to see ROW of cars parallel-parked on the street. JACKIE pulls up to the entrance of the CHURCH.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY
dialogues.text: STARKS watches JACKIE get out of the car and walk up to t doors of the CHURCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE boldly opens the CHURCH door. 100.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE sees the town seated in the Church. The PRIEST loo up at her briefly and some people turn around, but she cl the DOOR before she causes a major interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move to the third or fourth row, where, from behind, w see a head of GREY HAIR. He slowly turns around, casting look towards the door and revealing a glimpse of his face Though it's aged slightly, it hasn't softened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS watch as the people file out of Church. They are leaning against her car when STARKS spots him. DR. BECKER walks beside a SMALL CHILD -- presumably his GRANDSON. JACKIE registers his formidableness with some surprise; Becker's maintained a strong physique and is ha a shade less intimidating than he was before. Only his ha has a permanent shake now. STARKS doesn't waste any time. He heads straight for him. Almost sensing him, BECKER looks in his direction. The ca look on his face is instantly supplanted by one of DISBEL

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You still go to Church. How's that work? Your God just doesn't notice? That it? [Beat, serious] How you doin', Dr. Becker? BECKER stops walking and looks at Starks. His GRANDSON lo at him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER'S GRANDSON
dialogues.text: Grandpa? BECKER [Still looking at Starks] Sean, why don't you wait for me by the car? I'll be there in a minute. [Turning to the kid] Ok? His grandson, momentarily appeased, heads for the car. BECKER [To Starks] Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't know, Dr. Becker. Can you?  102. That's enough to confirm for BECKER who STARKS is. All around them, people leaving Church socialize routinel unaware of the haunted history being made between them.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I think you know. Your eyes say you do.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: [Beat] You're his son?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. I'm not his son. I'm him. [Beat] What? You look like you've seen a ghost. You can come here and touch me, old man. I'm the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: How...how are you here? STARKS looks at Becker -- each a terrifying reminder of t other's past.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: You died, Starks. Years ago, in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I know. [Beat] You killed me, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: No. I didn't. I swear I didn't. I probably helped push you to kill yourself, but I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I didn't kill myself. I died from a blow to the head. How'd it happen? I have to know. BECKER looks at him, nearly too stunned to speak.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I don't know how you died. The last time I put you in the Jacket was just after you told me you remembered killing that police officer...  103.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I didn't say I remembered killing him. I just repeated some words to get myself back in there.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I know. [Beat] I knew that when you came out.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Because...because you came out and said something you couldn't have possibly have known. You came back and repeated three names... BECKER falters as he recalls his offenses.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: Of people like you. People I was just trying to help. They couldn't get worse so I thought, with medication, they might get...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Medication? What kind of meds do you chase with nights in a cadaver drawer?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: It was part of the treatment I intended...I didn't know what the effects would be...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: So, what, you guinea pig sick people to find out?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: The three of you weren't regular patients. You were criminals that ended up at Alpine Grove.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No, we were patients. BECKER concedes after all this time.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: You and the others didn't seem that way then.  104. STARKS is quiet as he comes to understand how it's about work out: if Becker tells him those names now, he essenti indicts himself.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Who were the others? BECKER remembers with a hint of remorse. BECKER [Racked with remorse] Nathan Piechowski, Jackson MacGregor, and Ted Casey. [Beat] I didn't ask for you -- for any of you. You were all sent to me. STARKS looks at Becker, in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: What is it? STARKS just stares at Becker, waiting for the realization hit him, too.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: How did you come to know their names?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You just told me. The last time I was with you was when I was in the Jacket. I'm in it right now, Dr. Becker.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'm in it as we speak. [Beat] You're haunting yourself right now. [Beat] I guess sometimes we indict ourselves if no one else does. You didn't make history like you wanted to, huh, Dr. Becker. It turned out different, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: I didn't put you in Alpine Grove.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. [Beat] You put me on drugs and then you put me in the Jacket.  105. BECKER [Stoically] I was sorry when I heard you died. I was, but...how was I to know you didn't shoot that police officer?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: The same way you just said I didn't without my ever telling you. [Beat] And that still doesn't excuse what you did. Just because you had keys to a cage didn't mean you had animals inside. [Beat] You've earned your guilt, Becker. STARKS shares a last look with Becker before he walks awa towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS sit inside the parked car as STARKS tou his head.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: That's all you got from him? That bastard helped take your life away from you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No, he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What? How can you say that? He's the one that put you in that goddamn medieval...Jacket. He's probably the one who killed you. And with those words, JACKIE starts to break down.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No one's killing anyone. STARKS takes her hand and runs it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Touch me. I'm okay. STARKS looks at her with love, understanding and, for the first time, a sense of peace. He strokes her hair to calm down.  106.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: If everything hadn't happened the way it has, then I wouldn't be here right now, sitting in a car with you, touching your face.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Why are you saying that? [Beat] We don't have long, do we? STARKS looks at her without answering. JACKIE wipes her e fastens STARKS' seat belt, and seeing that Starks' EYES h started to flutter, starts driving. In the distance, the barely audible sound of the DRAWER opening, and their tim ending, is heard.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: To the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS speed on the highway. As STARKS sleeps, JACKIE keeps looking over at him like it's a way to make he stays with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE helps STARKS -- who's severely weakened at this po to the nurse's station. CLAIRE is there.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Claire, I need help. CLAIRE helps JACKIE, and they take him into a room. From afar, we hear CLAIRE asking about him.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: What's happening to me? Why am I getting so much weaker?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Because your body can only take so much of what they're putting you through.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Jesus, what's happened to him?  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE helps CLAIRE do for STARKS what they can; it doesn seem like much at this point.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Lorenson's the only one that could let me out of there. I need something to persuade her that I was there. Get me something to take to her.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Ok. Ssh. Rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE stands above a PRINTER as it prints the informatio she's looked up about Dr. Lorenson. The PAPER gets jammed and that's when JACKIE completely loses it. She WRESTLES the printer as if it were responsible for what's happenin Then she realizes she's not alone. She looks back and see CLAIRE, watching from the doorway, with a sympathetic loo her eyes. JACKIE [In a panic] He's not...?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No, no. [Beat] Not yet. But he doesn't have long. Are you sure you don't want a doctor to look at him?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: No! It won't do any good. [Beat] Please, Claire. They won't understand. CLAIRE acquiesces with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is trapped: back on the day when Officer Harrison murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cont'd from the scene after STARKS left Jean and Jackie' Place):  108. STARKS is walking back on the same highway just after the has set, and just after he helped JEAN and JACKIE, on tha fateful day... This time we see a CAR stop for him from a much closer distance. TENNY pulls up towards STARKS and rolls down th window on the passenger side. STARKS bends down to be abl see the driver.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: Hey, Mister, you need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: I'm going to Canada but I can let you ride with me up to the border. STARKS considers this.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: Can you drive?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: TENNY
dialogues.text: Great, get in. We'll switch off in a bit. We pull back and see the same SHOT, from a distance, of STARKS putting his BAG in the back and getting in. As he opens the CAR DOOR, we hear the MUSIC playing inside. As drive off, the MUSIC fades further and further in the distance as we...

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM, JACKIE'S APARTMENT, NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's the night that they slept together, and the departur never saw. We see, from Starks' POV, JACKIE sleeping serenely in the bed. We catch one glimpse of STARKS in the moonlight, standing naked in the doorway, before he turns and then...disappea having been taken out of the Jacket at that point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE is by STARKS' side, lying on the hospital bed, nex him, smoothing his sweating head.  109.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: William, please, honey, wake up. For me. STARKS' eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? STARKS nods; JACKIE tries to continue without choking up.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I found out about Eugene. The little boy. He's the key. That's who you have to tell her about when you get back there. It's the only way to prove this to her. JACKIE's VOICE fades as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON watches EUGENE continue to look unresponsively in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is awake, watching JACKIE sleep wearily on his che He sees the TOLL this has taken on her, just as he senses is about to be taken out of the Jacket. He nudges her gen

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Jackie? JACKIE stirs her eyes to look at him. STARKS [Somewhat urgently] Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: When we first met, when you were 7, where was the house you lived in with your mother? Do you remember your address?  110.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: 112 Orchard Way. [Realizing, ina whisper] You're not coming back, are you? STARKS, faint, struggles to get out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You gotta stop thinking like that.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Then, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
