dialogues.text: Nowhere. [Beat] I just think I'm gonna be sick. STARKS moves towards the bathroom of the hospital room. JACKIE moves to help him and he motions for her to stop. STARKS falters in the doorway when he turns to look back Jackie -- like it might be for the last time. JACKIE [In a whisper] You come back to me... STARKS nods, then goes in and closes the door behind him. JACKIE stares after him -- alone in the total silence of room. She listens for the slightest noise and that's when actually hears the sound of the DRAWER being opened for herself. She realizes he's gone. She RUSHES after him, opens the d in a fit, and then, sees what she feared most: no sign of Starks. JACKIE falls to her knees, right there, on the bathroom floor and cries out like a woman only beginning realize how unfathomably deep her heart is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is suddenly in the waiting area outside Lorenson's office -- still severely weakened. He walks slowly to the OFFICE DOOR and feebly knocks. LORENSON answers and STARKS falls into her arms. LORENSON [Stunned] Oh dear God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON has laid STARKS down on the COUCH in her office. STARKS can barely talk. He spews as much of it as he can in his feverish state...  111.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'm William Starks. I'm not his son. And...and the kid you work with. Your friend's son...Eugene... LORENSON is stilled by the words STARKS just spoke.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I know. I know it all. Save your strength. I already know everything you're going to say. [Beat] You're in the Jacket right now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: How...-how do you know?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You told me this was how it happened.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. STARKS clutches his side in pain as they prepare to take out.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Who...who kills me?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You have nothing to fear, William. But when we look to see STARKS' reaction, he's not there.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BECKER'S OFFICE, ALPINE GROVE, EVENING
dialogues.text: BECKER is dressed to leave the hospital when he suddenly decides not to. He takes off his coat and his gloves, but his SCARF, and walks out of his office with a decided urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER pulls STARKS out of the drawer and looks down ruef at STARKS' scathed face. STARKS, drenched in BLOOD and SW seeks the outline of Becker's face in the light. STARKS [Whispering] Becker, I know about you. [Beat] I know what you did to your patients.  112. BECKER looses the straps around Starks' neck to help him speak.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Nathan...Piechowski. [Beat] Jackson MacGregor...Ted Casey. [Beat] You didn't cure them. You killed them. BECKER momentarily loses color and his forever cool mien. After some seconds, STARKS passes out and BECKER -- hands trembling -- looks as though he might stick him back in w instead, he starts to remove him from the Jacket himself. silently and carefully unties each of the straps -- takin unusual care for Starks' flesh as he prepares to put him stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STARKS' ROOM, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: As the SUN starts to rise, we see STARKS -- now cleaned u recovering in his bed. He is unconscious. From his window look down and see Dr. Lorenson's car pulling into the lot

dialogues.speaker: INT. STARKS' ROOM, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: LORENSON, still wearing her winter gear, walks into Stark room, anxiously checking his VITALS. Her anxious expressi reveals Starks' frailty. She looks to the window then and sees an empty chair with only Becker's SCARF on it. LORENSON goes to the window in time to see BECKER getting into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lies unconscious in the bed. The NURSE, SALLY, sto by the room to check on Dr. Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Would you like anything, Dr. Lorenson?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: A cup of coffee would be great, Sally. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Is he gonna be ok?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I hope so.  113.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Me, too. LORENSON looks after her as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON wakes up as STARKS stirs in his sleep, slowly wa up.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You're going to be ok, William. We just need to get your fever down and we'll be able to hopefully stabilize you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Who are you kidding, Doc? You or me? LORENSON doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Can I get some paper and something to write with.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: What for? STARKS [Solemnly] I'm starting to think I'm really gonna die soon. So I'd like to write some things down.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let that happen.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You still don't believe me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: I do believe you...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No. Listen to me...the kid, Eugene... LORENSON still gets taken aback by Starks' knowledge of Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No one knows you're working with him so how would I have found out? He's your friend's son, right? It's true; no one could have known about Lorenson's priv life. STARKS LORENSON has STARKS closes his eyes, gathering what strength he can. That's all STARKS can manage before LORENSON sees he's ab coughs, clearly in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: William, I can't indulge these delusions, even when you're in this state.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Listen to me. That's all I ask. no choice.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: He's having absence [pronounced "absance"] seizures when he stares off into space like he does. He has them so often that that's why he hasn't learned to speak properly.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Who told you this?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You did, in the future. You figured it out because a part of you already knows this. That's how it works. [Beat] I'm just telling you something you already know, even if you haven't realized it.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I don't know when it'll happen but soon I think, you'll shock the boy and it'll wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You'll figure it out and you'll do good by him. to pass out again. Cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON answers the KNOCK at her door. It's EUGENE and TALIA.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: What is it? LORENSON [Finding it hard to explain] Nothing. [Beat] I don't know. I thought of something I could try. LORENSON looks at TALIA helplessly. TALIA nods and leads Eugene inside. LORENSON can't help but look down the hall make sure no one's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON sits across from EUGENE, holding up a picture of DOG. Between them is a tray of MILK and COOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Come on Eugene, try to say it with me. This is a "DOG".

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: D--d---d----. But Eugene can't hold the sound of the letter long enough make the word. An absence seizure takes hold of him as he looks out unconsciously into space. LORENSON moves closer to him. LORENSON [Softly] What's happening to you? LORENSON checks Eugene's pulse and leans in close to the boy's unconscious face like the answer is there if she ju looks hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Are you having a seizure? Is that really what's going on? LORENSON spots a corner of Eugene's EYE twitching slightl and, rushing to get a better look, takes the shade off of nearby LAMP and holds it above his head so she can get a better look at him.  116. Just then, TALIA opens the door, startling Lorenson. She knocks over the MILK and, as it spills on the LAMP CORD - on Eugene's lap -- it causes an ELECTRIC SHOCK. Eugene ca it. TALIA gasps and Lorenson watches the boy in fear. The moment passes and Eugene -- more responsive than he h ever been before -- looks at his mother and Lorenson. He doesn't know what's happened but he is aware, and awake, like never before. EUGENE picks right up where he and Lorenson left off.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Dog. [To Talia] Hi. TALIA and LORENSON look at him and each other at shock. STARKS [0.S., distantly] You're going to...shock the boy and then things will change for him.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You ok, Eugene? EUGENE holds Lorenson's gaze steadily for a few moments. LORENSON [Stunned himself] Yeah, you are ok.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: What's happening? LORENSON [Putting the pieces together] He got a little shock. [To himself] And it's reset him. Not permanently probably...but at least for a little while. They use it on epileptic patients sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: But he's not epileptic.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: No, but he is having seizures. TALIA looks at LORENSON. She's still confused. LORENSON's merely surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks up from his PAPER -- now covered in WORDS -- see Dr. Lorenson in the doorway. STARKS still looks weak much better than before.  117.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: It worked, didn't it? LORENSON nods. STARKS folds

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: This is really happening, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LORENSON
dialogues.text: [Beat] What do you need me to do?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] Thank you. the LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I need to get this letter to someone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LORENSON
dialogues.text: I can't take you out of here in your condition...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: And I can't stay here in my condition. I am going to die tonight. It's already been decided.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LORENSON
dialogues.text: No, it hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Yes. [Beat] It has. Everything up ‘till today is done. Everything starting with tomorrow is up for grabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON helps STARKS into the parking lot as it snows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON and STARKS are driving on the same, now familiar highway.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You know how to get there?  118.

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Good. Bob Dylan plays on the RADIO. STARKS smiles as he hears h and turns the music up; the act is sad because, as LORENS notices, it belongs to someone with an interest to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON and STARKS drive up to Jean and Jackie's hou

dialogues.speaker: LORENSON
dialogues.text: You want me to come with you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: No, I'll be ok. STARKS slowly makes his way to their front door and knock it as best as he can. The sound, however, is still understandably soft. STARKS waits and then reaches for the knob on the door. H opens it and looks inside. We first see his face, and the devastation on it, as we guess the sight he's laid eyes o JACKIE is sitting at the kitchen table, still only 7 year old. Though STARKS expected it, he falters under the disappointment of seeing a girl he liked instead of the w he loved. As she looks up at him, it's all he can do not break down.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Hi. JACKIE [Surprised] Hey. [Beat] I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I remember you, too. STARKS shakes his head, looking at her. She looks beautif and still hopeful. Her life lays ahead of her and her fat when he found her in 2004 -- remains as distant as possib from this innocent, still promising image.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Jackie, how have you been?  119. JACKIE smiles; she doesn't get asked that often. STARKS nods. crumble. She looks at his eyes. JACKIE calls

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I've been ok.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Good. How's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Ok, I guess. JACKIE smiles. It's all he can do not to

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Do you think I could see her? him and senses, like kids do, the desperation in

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Sure. out for Jean, then runs up the stairs to get her. LORENSON has gotten out of the car and is waiting outside on the porch. STARKS remains in the doorway. Some seconds better state JEAN looks a later, JEAN appears -- gaunt but in a slightly than we saw her before.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Hey, Jean. Nice to see you. little confused.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? Your face looks awfully familiar, I just can't quite place it...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Mom, this is the guy that drove us home that afternoon we were stuck on the highway. The guy you yelled at for no good reason...

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  120. She gives him a once over, and, seeing how weakened he lo decides intuitively he can't be much harm. She also notic LORENSON waiting by the car. STARKS looks

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: There something you need?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You could say that. at JACKIE, hesitating because of her. Sensing this, JEAN asks Jackie to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Jackie, go play in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Just do it. JACKIE leaves and walks to the yard. STARKS watches. STARKS hands

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I can't stay long. [Motioning to Lorenson] That's my doctor and I gotta get back to the hospital. Everything I want to say is in this letter. [Beat] You can check as much of it as you can. her the LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I won't be around when you read it...but I hope you believe it. It'd be a real shame if you didn't. JEAN looks baffled but, seeming to grasp his urgency, nod

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] I should be on my way. JACKIE has been watching this exchange from the shed. Whe looks over there, he catches her eye and CALLS OUT, with strength he has left...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Bye, Jackie.  121. These are the hardest words STARKS has probably ever had say. JACKIE just stares after him, as does JEAN, as he sh himself out.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Happy New Year to both of you.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STARKS is walking away, we see his eyes begin to tear the cold -- but not from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE abruptly runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hey, wait! STARKS stops in his tracks; he clears as much sadness fro his face as he can before he turns around to face her.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: [Beat] You be good to yourself, Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Ok. Then, suddenly, she sticks her hand for him to shake, as did that day on the roadside; only now, it trembles sligh in the cold. STARKS takes JACKIE'S HAND and holds it in his own softly affectionately. JEAN and DR. LORENSON look on curiously a STARKS looks in her face, at her hand in his, and then to heavens for the means to get through this. As STARKS lets go at last, JACKIE looks back at him, sens the connection even if she doesn't know it yet. STARKS turns and stumbles as he walks back to his car. LORENSON moves to help him, but STARKS tells her not to w his eyes. He makes his way to the car on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN sits down and starts to open the LETTER. Starks' voi as we hear it now, is presumably from parts of the LETTER he's written to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks over to STARKS, who stares painfully out t window. They drive on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was 25 years old the first time I died. It didn't end anything though. [Beat] Sometimes I think we live through things only to be able to tell them, to bear witness, to say this happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks back through the gates of the hospital, despondently returning inside, with LORENSON at his side.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And it wasn't to someone else. It was to me. And I lived despite it. Sometimes I think we live to beat the odds. And sometimes I agree that life can only begin with the knowledge of death. That it can all end, even when you least want it to.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WARD, ALPINE GROVE, EVENING
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE looks up from his game of solitaire as LORENSON helps STARKS down the hall. He holds up his hand in the gesture of hello, or goodbye. STARKS raises his hand back with an earnest smile.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'm telling you my story because it's the only way I can try to help your daughter, and you, have a better one of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see BECKER taking his DRUGS. In his dark den, on his w desk, is a bottle of WHISKEY. He closes his eyes as he administers to himself whatever aid he can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN is reading each page avidly, affected by this man's words.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's scary...and lucky...how much we can forget. Scary because we think the past gives us our bearing, and lucky because in those moments I'm talking about, you realize it doesn't. And it never had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY (Officer Harrison's murderer) is at the bar orderin drink from the BARTENDER. As he gets his DRINK, he slaps BILL down on the counter and turns around to survey the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE rummages in a box of her personal belongings, look for something specific in them. She stops finally when sh finds STARKS' DOG TAGS. She takes them out slowly and put them around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am not a crazy man, even though they mistook me for one. I live in the same world as the rest of you. Only I saw more of it. Then, after a moment of staring down at them, she tucks t under her sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY holds a beer as he stares blankly at a TV broadcasting news about MIKE TYSON'S RAPE CONVICTION. Medley's barely watching the footage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lorenson helps Starks back to bed. STARKS looks up at Lorenson, thanking her without words but with his eyes. LORENSON smiles as she looks back sadly at Starks' even m weakened self.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And the seeing is the only way you can hear what the truth around you is saying: you can always start believing in things you don't already believing in. And, while you're alive, it's never too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns and walks out, closing the door so that Sta room and the screen darken at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PAIRS of legs walk down a corridor, darkened by the night, through the now familiar passage to the basement.. STARKS is not restrained this time though we don't see wh walking down the hall with him. He runs his hand over his forehead and looks at it when he's done. STILL NO CUT. They slow down their pace as they round the corner, as ST appears dizzier and dizzier. He doesn't stop and the PERS beside him doesn't see how weak he is... until STARKS TRI In slow motion, we hear a DISTANT, GARBLED VOICE CALL OUT

dialogues.speaker: DISTORTED VOICE
dialogues.text: No! Wa...atch out! But STARKS' head hits the GLASS CASE of the FIRE EXTINGUI on the wall, as it was destined to. In the terrific SHOWE GLASS, one PIECE cuts a neat, deep, fatal GASH in Starks' head. BLOOD starts to flow. As STARKS' eyes struggle to regain their focus, we see the BLURRED, indiscernible FACE of th PERSON leaning over him to see if he's all right. The details start to make sense, even to Starks. This is WOUND they said he died from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS collapses on the familiar slab, ready to be strapp into the Jacket one final time. BLOOD pours from his head onto the floor. The PERSON with him struggles to get all of Starks' weigh onto the metal slab. She's doing it as carefully, and gen as she can -- taking observable care with every strap of JACKET, almost as if the act itself is a humane one. When the HANDS finally reach the straps around his neck a the hardest part of the struggle has passed, STARKS smile kindly, and thankfully, into the single overhead LIGHT in room that obscures the face of the person strapping him i As the drawer is pushed in, one of the STRAPS gets caught the side, CUTTING STARKS' ARM. We hear a small CRY in the room. Then the HANDS adjust the strap and slowly push STA in.  125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more beautiful and serene inside than it's ever been before. This time, as he travels through the tunnel, it's though he's traveling in a heaven of his own. The IMAGES sees are the best moments of his past -- connected in a tranquil, fluid narrative that suggest STARKS has finally retrieved his memory without it haunting him...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I promise you, Jean. No matter how bad the days and things around you look, they look better awake than they do asleep. I can offer you some proof: when you die, there's only one thing you want to have happen...sometimes so badly it comes true, I guess. [Beat] You want to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PANELS we saw briefly are completed further now. 1) C.U. A WOMAN'S NECK as a small child's HAND touches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aged 9, running up the stairs, knocking a PICTURE on the with his elbow... 3) C.U. A black and white PHOTOGRAPH of Starks' father, a much older version of himself. 4) EXT. CREEK: A shot of clear water that's not to deep a on its surface, the reflection of a TEENAGE BOY'S FACE be he touches it and sends it rippling... 5) EXT. A NEW ENGLAND BEACH: STARKS (20s) dressed in a bl suit, holding an URN, letting the ASHES fly into the wate 6) EXT. DESERT: A SANDSTORM WHIRLS round before it's repl with... EXT. VERMONT: A FIELD of snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that it was DR. LORENSON who put Starks in. Exhausted from the physical strain of getting him in ther she stares at the closed drawer, like looking at it is on way to look after Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN puts down STARKS' LETTER and walks out of the kitche and watches JACKIE sitting absently on the couch, looking past the TV. JEAN kneels wordlessly beside her daughter and looks her daughter in the eye. JACKIE looks back curiously as JEAN wraps her arms around Jackie's LEGS and rests her head in lap, holding onto her with the dearness of having narrowl missed a tragedy. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of CARS slushing in the snow, an IMAGE fa up slowly on the screen, until we see it's STARKS, standi in the parking lot outside the diner once more. This time he seems situated, and hopeful. After a slightl longer wait than the first time, JACKIE walks out -- in t same way as before except that she wears a NURSE'S UNIFOR and an unmistakable air of vitality. Jackie looks directly at Starks and we see the same attraction between them teeming even more than before. Ev as a physically injured man in jeans and a flannel, with BLEEDING CUT on his head and no coat in the cold, STARKS someone we see she wants to be near. Then we see JACKIE as STARKS does: she looks beautiful, alive, happy and just like the woman he never wanted to leave. She approaches Starks warmly, less suspicious of t world -- and less devastated by it -- than we remember he being.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hey there. [Beat] You ok? STARKS revels in the moment. In their reunion.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You're bleeding pretty bad there. STARKS touches his FOREHEAD in a panic and, seeing the BL on his hands, looks up at her, terrified. Sensing this, s moves closer to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It's ok. It's ok. Relax. It's just a cut. We can get it fixed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE (cont'd) But we need to get you to the hospital now. How'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I fell down. [Beat] But I'm alive. STARKS looks at her -- immensely relieved and grateful. JACKIE [Laughing a little] Yes, you are alive. But, listen, it's New Year's Day. You're not going to get a cab. Especially not here. And you're gonna freeze if you stand out here in the snow much longer. I'm on my way back to my shift at the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: You work there? JACKIE [Gesturing to her uniform] Yeah, I'm a nurse. Why don't you let me give you a ride... STARKS falters slightly as he walks. JACKIE helps him mak to the car, much like before...

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS can hardly keep his eyes off her when her CELL PHO suddenly rings.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, one sec. JACKIE answers it, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hey! How are you? [Beat] Thanks. I was just thinking about you, too. STARKS listens nervously to her conversation and the affection in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Listen, I gotta go, mom, ‘cause I'm late... but, thanks. Happy New Year to you, too. I'll call you later. [Beat] Ok, bye.  128. JACKIE hangs up and looks at Starks -- feeling a little awkward after the call.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. It was my mom. STARKS smiles back warmly at her; he gets it more than sh knows.

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: Nothin' to worry about there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie's car pulls onto the highway, alongside the other, more modern cars on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: STARKS
dialogues.text: I'm doing fine. The happy sound of their engine on the highway continues, uninterrupted, for some seconds, before, first faintly th louder, we hear a racking, all too familiar sound: the DR creaking as it's opened once more...
